newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Dragonfield seen issuing 90mln shrs in IPO-sources.
newsitem.headline: Dragonfield seen issuing 90mln shrs in IPO-sources.

text.p: Leather garments manufacturer and distributor Dragonfield Holdings Ltd is expected to issue 90 million new shares at HK$1.00 each in an initial public offering (IPO) in Hong Kong, market sources said on Monday.
"The issue price is expected to represent a P/E (price/earnings) multiple of about eight times," said an analyst after attending a company presentation on Monday.
Sources said net proceeds raised were expected to be used to expand the company's distribution network in Hong Kong and China.
Dragonfield engages in trading and manufacturing of leather garments in Hong Kong and China.
Sources said the manufacture of garments accounted for about 45 percent of its total sales for the year ended in March 1996, while 55 percent was from distribution of leather garments.

The company posted a turnover of HK$371.35 million for the year ended in March 1996, up from HK$234.14 million in 1995. Its profit was at HK$34.91 million in 1996, up from HK$29.49 million in 1995, sources said.
The IPO is expected to kick off later in April with dealing in shares to begin in May, sources said. Lippo Securities is expected to be the sponsor of the issue, they said.
